title: Loch Treig Walk Map Route

images.title: Loch Treig wall by AlastairG, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Loch Treig wall

images.title: Richard Webb / A near natural Loch Treig
images.caption: A near natural Loch Treig Beneath the hydroelectric reservoir of Loch Treig is a natural loch. The water is drawn down almost to the level of the old loch.

images.title: Nigel Brown / View south west from Stob Coire Sgriodain
images.caption: View south west from Stob Coire Sgriodain. The tremendous west side of Stob Coire Sgriodain gives a wonderful eagle's eye view down to Loch Treig. Of the distant peaks, the Buachaille Etive Mor is just left of centre.

description: This walk visits Loch Treig near Fort William, in Lochaber, in the Scottish Highlands. Just north of the loch you'll find a parking area at Fersaid Bridge where you can start the walk. From here you can follow a footpath south along the River Treig to the Treig Dam. The path continues south along the lake with fine views across the water to the surrounding mountains. For wonderful views down to the loch you could climb to Stob Coire Sgriodain on its eastern side. To continue your waterside walking in the area head south east to visit Loch Ossian .
